title: WTB: 1870s Boston & 1880s-1892 NY Giants, Jim O'Rourke
author: orator1

posts.post_title: WTB: 1870s Boston & 1880s-1892 NY Giants, Jim O'Rourke
posts.post_content:
I'm interested in buying items that picture Orator James O'Rourke, either individually or with his teams, including cards/cabinets/CDVs, illustrations, scorecards with his image, etc.

He played primarily for three teams:
1873-1878 & 1880 Boston
1881-1884 Buffalo
1885-1892 NY Giants

If you have anything available please let me know.

Thanks,
Paul
orator1

I have a collection I am selling off, and I havent gotten to this point yet, but I have a PSA 1MK Jim O'Rourke 1887 N172 Old Judge PSA 1(MK) that will be for sale.  Its  a pop 1 and None have been graded aside from this one.  There is a stamp on the back of the card, hence the (MK) designation.  

-Matt
Thanks for your response Matt.  I'm interested, so when you're ready to sell just let me know.

I'm interested in all variations of O'Rourke's N172, N173, N284 Buchner Gold Coin, WG1 Playing Card, just to name a few.  Also, any individual O'Rourke or team cabinets by J. Wood or Joseph Hall would be great.
Paul -- I sent you an email regarding an O'Rourke N284 PSA4. Thanks!
For some reason I'm not receiving emails sent through net54.  They're not in my spam folder either.  Please email me directly at [url]paulconanjr@aol.com[/url].  Thanks.

[quote name="orator1" post=2308454]I'm interested in all variations of O'Rourke's N172, N173, N284 Buchner Gold Coin, WG1 Playing Card, just to name a few.  Also, any individual O'Rourke or team cabinets by J. Wood or Joseph Hall would be great.[/QUOTE]

In addition to the above cards, I'm also interested in items such as the Nov. 10, 1888, Police Gazette picturing the Giants, the 1886 Lorillard Tobacco NY team, N167 OJ of O'Rourke, The Daily Graphic from June 11, 1873, and O'Rourke's New York Clipper from Oct. 25, 1879. I'm still in the beginning stages of my Jim O'Rourke-focused collection, so any help is appreciated.
